### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #21966 (Remove double serialization; use software encoder for fee estimation by sipa)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
I think this can be closed as it is included in #21966.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
🐙 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>

comments.body: Looks like the current templates are set up such that this fails compilation even if removed completely. Though, I am worried that in the future it will silently fall back from `float` -> `double`, so I've added the `static_assert(false)` to ensure this is never compiled.
I kind of hope we can remove the double case as well some time soon. But I think this is fine for now.

I'm fine with doing this or not. Even if it's accidentally invoked, at worst it'll result in serialization as a double, which is just 4 bytes bigger, but no loss compared to (highly hypothetical) expected float serialization.
Should be easy to remove it in a follow-up. E.g https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21966#issuecomment-842528708
